channel.title: Comments on: Learning Haskel For Fun (and profit?)

item.title: By: lefthandedgoat
item.dc:creator: lefthandedgoat
item.description: (42, "meaning of life") is the syntax for a tuple in F#
item.content:encoded: (42, “meaning of life”) is the syntax for a tuple in F#

item.title: By: Julian Birch
item.dc:creator: Julian Birch
item.description: I think the problem is that tuples are more useful if you can destructure them and not have to declare their parameter types all of the time.
item.content:encoded: I think the problem is that tuples are more useful if you can destructure them and not have to declare their parameter types all of the time.

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: Yeah, that's quite a bit more clean. I didn't know about that option, thanks!
item.content:encoded: Yeah, that’s quite a bit more clean. I didn’t know about that option, thanks!

item.title: By: Omer Mor
item.dc:creator: Omer Mor
item.description: It's easier to write Tuple.Create(42, "meaning of life") and let the compiler infer the types.
item.content:encoded: It’s easier to write Tuple.Create(42, “meaning of life”) and let the compiler infer the types.

item.title: By: Frank Quednau
item.dc:creator: Frank Quednau
item.description:
Some time ago I also delved into Haskell from a .NET dev perspective. I documented quite a few bits at my site: http://realfiction.net/tag/Haskell
As to where Haskell is used in real stuff out there, I also don't have an answer...
item.content:encoded:
Some time ago I also delved into Haskell from a .NET dev perspective. I documented quite a few bits at my site: http://realfiction.net/tag/Haskell

As to where Haskell is used in real stuff out there, I also don’t have an answer…

item.title: By: Maris Krivtezs
item.dc:creator: Maris Krivtezs
item.description: Check this presentation of Bryan O'Sullivan: http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Running-a-Startup-on-Haskell and this one: http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Distributed-Applications-with-Haskell-and-Riak
item.content:encoded:
Check this presentation of Bryan O’Sullivan: 
http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Running-a-Startup-on-Haskell
and this one:
http://www.infoq.com/presentations/Distributed-Applications-with-Haskell-and-Riak
